description: The Breakfast team have been monkeying around with one of the stars of new series 'Spy in the Wild'.
title: BBC Breakfast presenters meet 'Orangu-cam'

description: The survivors were rescued after two days in freezing conditions, but some 15 people remain missing.
title: Italy avalanche: Four rescued from Rigopiano hotel

description: Rights groups say blasphemy allegations against disappeared activists aim to silent dissent for good.
title: Disappeared: Silencing Pakistan's activists

description: Rafael Nadal beats German teenager Alexander Zverev in five sets in the third round of the Australian Open.
title: Australian Open 2017: Rafael Nadal beats Alexander Zverev in five sets

description: Army helicopters are evacuating the injured after a Taliban bombing at a marketplace in Parachinar
title: Pakistan vegetable market bomb kills 20 and injures 40

description: Parking charges in parts of Belfast, Newry and Lisburn city centres are set to rise next month.
title: On-street parking fees rise Belfast, Newry and Lisburn

description: The NASUWT union tells members to end co-operation with school inspections.
title: Teachers urged to end co-operation with school inspections

description: A virtual reality project transforms learning for pupils at a Glengormley school.
title: Virtual reality project transforms learning for Glengormley pupils

description: A parade and service will take place to remember a war hero from Torfaen.
title: Cwmbran parade in memory of Rorke's Drift war hero

description: Esgob benywaidd cyntaf yr Eglwys yng Nghymru yn cael ei chysegru mewn seremoni yng Nghaerdydd ddydd Sadwrn.
title: Cysegru esgob benywaidd cyntaf Cymru, Joanna Penberthy

description: Aerial video shows a huge ice crack which is forcing British Antarctic Survey staff to leave their base.
title: Drone footage shows huge Antarctic ice crack

description: Documentary maker reflects on the life of astronaut Gene Cernan, following his death.
title: Last man to walk on the Moon, Gene Cernan, has died

description: SpaceX successfully launches a rocket, its first mission since an explosion in September.
title: SpaceX rocket successfully lifts off

description: Archaeological research at a site in Galloway suggests it may have been at the heart of a "lost kingdom" from the Dark Ages.
title: 'Lost kingdom' linked to Galloway

description: The moth, which has a wingspan of just over a centimetre, was discovered in California.
title: Moth with 'golden flake hairstyle' named after Donald Trump

description: Renewable energy will continue to grow in the US despite the antipathy of the incoming Trump administration.
title: Obama says shift to green energy is 'irreversible' despite Trump

description: Millions of women have no problem with the pill but some find it shatters their mental health. Here The Debrief's Vicky Spratt describes years of depression, anxiety and panic.
title: Nightmare on the pill

description: From a majestic natural spectacle to a high-octane technological thrill ride, here's our guide to the big science events of 2017.
title: Coming up

description: A selection of the best science and environment reads this year.
title: Science selection

description: From the first direct evidence for black holes, to a rocky planet circling a neighbouring star, 2016 was packed with amazing science stories.
title: Amazing science

description: Canadian "guerrilla" archivists will help in scramble to preserve US federal climate data.
title: Guerrilla archiving

description: Nintendo signals the "end of life" for its Wii U games console, which was first released in 2012.
title: Nintendo signals end for Wii U

description: Adverts for Google products occupied 91% of the top slots on the firm's search results pages.
title: Google placed its own ads first, study claims

description: Apple and Amazon have ended a deal that tied them into an exclusive contract for the supply and sale of audio books.
title: Amazon and Apple end exclusive deal on audio books

description: Minecraft, the game adored by millions of children, is allegedly at the heart of the web's biggest net attack.
title: Minecraft link to net's biggest botnet

description: Tesla will not be ordered to recall its semi-autonomous cars in the US, following a fatal crash in May 2016.
title: Tesla avoids recall after Autopilot crash death

description: A coalition of more than 70 civil rights groups urges Facebook to be clearer about content it removes.
title: Facebook urged to be more transparent over 'censorship'

description: Photographs taken in Iraq appear to show commercial drones adapted to drop grenades on the Iraqi security forces.
title: Photos show 'weaponised commercial drones' in Iraq

description: Police recorded an 8% rise in all offences in England and Wales as a survey shows figures in cybercrime and fraud.
title: New figures reveal scale of cybercrime

description: US owners of the Galaxy Note 7 who ignored a recall face a fresh effort to make them return the fire-risk phones.
title: Galaxy Note 7 recall refuseniks face new action

description: A Chicago-based drone operator is to pay the largest fine ever issued to settle claims it carried out dozens of illegal flights.
title: Drone photography company to pay $200,000 fine

description: Police in the Netherlands are contacting more than 20,000 people who they suspect had their data stolen by a rogue web developer.
title: Thousands warned they may be victims of rogue webmaster

description: Flush strength, front and back bidets, and air drying are all common features of toilets in Japan.
title: Japan's hi-tech toilets to get standardised symbols

description: EE, the UK's biggest mobile phone operator, broke billing rules, says regulator Ofcom.
title: EE mobile firm fined £2.7m for overcharging customers

description: Adult video websites appear to be exploiting a YouTube loophole to host explicit material on the platform.
title: Porn videos streamed 'via YouTube loophole'

description: President Vladimir Putin’s spokesman denies any Russian government involvement in hacking to influence the 2016 US election result.
title: Putin spokesman denies US election hack

description: BBC Click's Lara Lewington looks at some of the best of the week's technology news.
title: The telepresence bot operated by the mind and other news

description: The radar imaging system is capable of detecting movement and "seeing" through walls.
title: Radar sensor for the home which can 'see' through walls

description: A new crop of Nigerian developers is drawing on the depth of culture across the continent to make distinctly African games.
title: Welcome to Lagos - tech incubator

description: Silicon Valley is anxiously waiting to see how it will be affected by Donald Trump's presidency.
title: Silicon Valley awaits Donald Trump's presidency

description: The presidential Twitter handle will be handed over later - here's how it works.
title: How the @Potus handover from Obama to Trump works

description: "Average Rob" is editing himself into photos of Barack Obama and Joe Biden in his Instagram profile.
title: Instagram user Average Rob edits himself into Barack Obama and Joe Biden photos

description: BBC Click's Lara Lewington looks at a prototype robotic kitchen.
title: Meet Moley - the robotic kitchen

description: BAE Systems is researching the feasibility of an autonomous aircraft.
title: Developing an aeroplane that can fly itself

description: BBC Click's Nick Kwek looks at some of the best of the week's technology news.
title: Lasers give insight into bird flight and other tech news

description: BBC Click's Lara Lewington looks at how shops are creating more engaging shopping experiences.
title: Virtual reindeer and smart make-up mirrors

description: How BlaBlaCar created a global transport network with empty car seats.
title: BlaBla billions

description: Gaming expert Dan Maher has spent all day on the new Nintendo Switch console, making him one of the first people to review it.
title: Nintendo Switch hands-on

description: The government denies "playing catch-up" over drone safety despite a recent increase in prosecutions.
title: Flight plans

description: Nintendo has created some of the world's most memorable games consoles - but also had some big misses.
title: Nintendo consoles

description: The market for fitness trackers seems to be booming, but are these gadgets actually effective?
title: Fitness fail

description: BBC Click's Lara Lewington looks at the latest technology showcased at CES 2017.
title: CES 2017: Highlights from the technology show

description: A clothes-folding robot that has been in development for more than a decade is at the CES tech show to promote its imminent launch.
title: CES 2017: Clothes-folding Laundroid robot readies for launch

description: A new type of fold-up drone that follows its owner taking selfies is previewed at the CES tech show.
title: CES 2017: Roam-E drone takes flying selfies

description: An electric bike designed to cope with almost any terrain is one of several personal transport innovations at CES.
title: CES 2017: The 'go anywhere' electric bike and other transport tech

description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Donald Trump took power as the 45th president of the United States on Friday and pledged to end what he called an "American carnage" of rusted factories and crime in an inaugural address that was a populist and nationalist rallying cry.
title: Trump, now president, pledges to put 'America First' in nationalist speech

description: PENNE, Italy (Reuters) - Four people were pulled alive from the wreckage of a luxury hotel that was demolished on Wednesday by a deadly avalanche, bringing the number of survivors to nine, the national fire service said on Saturday.
title: Four more survivors extracted from Italian hotel hit by avalanche

description: DUBLIN (Reuters) - Sinn Fein will name a successor to Martin McGuinness on Monday to lead the Irish nationalist party into Northern Irish elections in March, its president Gerry Adams said on Friday.
title: Northern Ireland's Sinn Fein to name successor to McGuinness on Monday

description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - The dollar ended down while U.S. stock indexes rose in the last day of a choppy trading week, as investors reacted to President Donald Trump's inaugural speech.
title: Dollar falls, U.S. stocks end higher after Trump inauguration

description: (Reuters) - Apple Inc  filed a $1 billion (0.80 billion pound) lawsuit against supplier Qualcomm Inc  on Friday, days after the U.S. government accused the chip maker of resorting to anticompetitive tactics to maintain a monopoly over key semiconductors in mobile phones.
title: Apple files $1 billion lawsuit against chip supplier Qualcomm

description: KOBLENZ, Germany (Reuters) - Far-right populist leaders from Germany, France, Italy and the Netherlands meet in the German city of Koblenz on Saturday to present their vision for "a free Europe" that would dismantle the European Union.
title: Far-right leaders meet to discuss 'free Europe' vision

description: LONDON/FRANKFURT (Reuters) - U.S. banks Morgan Stanley  and Citigroup  have identified many of the roles that will need to be moved from Britain following its exit from the European Union, sources involved in the processes told Reuters.
title: Morgan Stanley, Citi plan Brexit job moves - sources

description: BANJUL (Reuters) - Gambia's leader Yahya Jammeh said on Saturday he would step down from power in a statement made in the face of pressure from West African armies that entered his country to remove him after he refused to concede an election defeat to President Adama Barrow.
title: Gambia's leader Jammeh says he will step down, ending political impasse

description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman appeared in a U.S. court on Friday after his surprise extradition from Mexico and pleaded not guilty to charges that he ran the world's largest drug-trafficking organization during a decades-long criminal career.
title: Mexican drug lord 'El Chapo' pleads not guilty in U.S. court

DATES.DATE2: more than four years in December

description: LONDON (Reuters) - British retail sales suffered their biggest slump in more than four years in December, denting what had been a promising fourth quarter and rattling sterling as more signs emerged of a pick-up in inflation since June's Brexit vote.
title: UK retail sales dive as inflation weighs, jolting sterling

description: LONDON (Reuters) - A banner reading "Build bridges not walls" was draped across London's Tower Bridge as part of several protests in Europe and Asia on Friday against the inauguration of Donald Trump as U.S. president.
title: British protesters tell Trump from Tower Bridge: "Build bridges not walls"

description: LONDON (Reuters) - Under the gaze of a life-sized cardboard figure of Donald Trump, some 200 of his supporters gathered at an exclusive club near the Ritz hotel in London to celebrate Friday's inauguration of America's 45th president.
title: Republicans in London celebrate Trump's inauguration

description: DUBLIN (Reuters) - Sinn Fein will name a successor to Martin McGuinness on Monday to lead the Irish nationalist party into Northern Irish elections in March, its president Gerry Adams said on Friday.
title: Northern Ireland's Sinn Fein to name successor to McGuinness on Monday

description: BELFAST (Reuters) - Children in Northern Ireland suffered decades of cruel sexual, physical and emotional abuse in institutions run by the state, charities and the Catholic and Protestant churches, an official report said on Friday.
title: Northern Irish children suffered decades of cruel abuse - report

description: (Reuters) - Nigel Farage, who led the campaign for Britain to leave the European Union, will be a political analyst on Fox News and Fox Business Network, Fox News said on Friday.
title: Fox News signs Brexit leader Nigel Farage as contributor

DATES.DATE2: more than four years in December

description: LONDON (Reuters) - British retail sales suffered their biggest slump in more than four years in December, denting what had been a promising fourth quarter and rattling sterling as more signs emerged of a pick-up in inflation since June's Brexit vote.
title: UK retail sales dive as inflation weighs, jolting sterling

description: LONDON (Reuters) - Taking Britain out of Europe's energy market could stymie development of new power links designed to help avert a looming supply crunch and also drive up the cost of imported European electricity, National Grid warned on Friday.
title: National Grid warns of costs if Britain exits EU energy market

description: LONDON (Reuters) - Scotland will vote to become independent within two years due to the hardline position being taken by British Prime Minister Theresa May over Brexit, former Scottish first minister Alex Salmond said on Friday.
title: Scotland will vote for independence in two years - Salmond

description: LONDON (Reuters) - British Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Friday it was an "open question" whether migrants from the European Union would enjoy easier access to Britain after Brexit than those from other parts of the world.
title: 'Open question' if post-Brexit UK will favour EU migrants - Hammond

description: LONDON (Reuters) - Britain's police watchdog is to hold an investigation after officers were filmed firing a stun-gun at their own local black race relations adviser who they apparently mistook for a wanted suspect, the force involved said on Friday.
title: British police use stun-gun on their own black race relations adviser

description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Donald Trump took power as the 45th president of the United States on Friday and pledged to end what he called an "American carnage" of rusted factories and crime in an inaugural address that was a populist and nationalist rallying cry.
title: Trump, now president, pledges to put 'America First' in nationalist speech

description: TOKYO,  (Reuters) - A day after Donald Trump became U.S. President and vowed to put "America First", Asian media decried his isolationist policies, fearing they will chill the global economy and sow widespread international discord.
title: Asian media decry isolationist Trump, fear economic, diplomatic turmoil

description: KABUL (Reuters) - Afghan chief executive Abdullah Abdullah on Saturday expressed hope that the United States would continue its support for the Afghan government after American President Donald Trump publicly spoke with U.S. troops stationed in Afghanistan after his inauguration on Friday.
title: Afghanistan's Abdullah welcomes Trump commitment to troops

description: NEW YORK/SEOUL (Reuters) - The U.S. government has asked South Korea to arrest a brother of former U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon on charges that he engaged in a bribery scheme to carry out the sale of a Vietnamese building complex, a U.S. prosecutor said on Friday.
title: U.S. asks South Korea to arrest former U.N. chief Ban's brother

description: ANKARA (Reuters) - The Turkish parliament has backed a plan to strengthen the powers of the presidency, paving the way for a referendum on the issue in spring which, if passed, could allow President Tayyip Erdogan to stay in office until 2029.
title: Turkish parliament approves presidential system, paving way for referendum

description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan (Reuters) - An explosion in a busy vegetable market killed at least 21 people on Saturday in Pakistan's remote northwestern tribal region, an official said.
title: Blast kills at least 21 in Pakistan vegetable market, says official

description: KOBLENZ, Germany (Reuters) - Far-right populist leaders from Germany, France, Italy and the Netherlands meet in the German city of Koblenz on Saturday to present their vision for "a free Europe" that would dismantle the European Union.
title: Far-right leaders meet to discuss 'free Europe' vision

description: PENNE, Italy (Reuters) - Four people were pulled alive from the wreckage of a luxury hotel that was demolished on Wednesday by a deadly avalanche, bringing the number of survivors to nine, the national fire service said on Saturday.
title: Four more survivors extracted from Italian hotel hit by avalanche

description: VERONA, Italy (Reuters) - Sixteen people were killed and about 40 injured after a bus carrying Hungarian students burst into flames on a highway in northern Italy, police and the fire service said on Saturday.
title: Sixteen dead, mostly Hungarian teenagers, in Italy bus accident - police

description: SEOUL (Reuters) - South Korean prosecutors arrested the culture minister on Saturday, on suspicion of abuse of power for drawing up a blacklist of artists, writers and entertainers critical of the country's impeached president, Park Geun-hye.
title: South Korea's culture minister arrested over arts blacklist in political scandal

description: (Reuters) - Apple Inc filed a $1 billion lawsuit against supplier Qualcomm Inc on Friday, days after the U.S. government accused the chip maker of resorting to anticompetitive tactics to maintain a monopoly over key semiconductors in mobile phones.
title: Apple files $1 billion lawsuit against chip supplier Qualcomm

description: (Reuters) - Amazon.com Inc has put its popular Dash button on its website and mobile app, making it easier for shoppers to buy their favorite items such as peanut butter, detergent and paper towels.
title: Amazon's Dash button goes online

description: OTTAWA (Reuters) - Canada's business competition watchdog said on Friday it had reached an agreement with Apple Inc and three major e-book publishers that will allow retailers to offer discounts to customers.
title: Canada's Competition Bureau reaches deal with Apple, publishers

description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Outgoing U.S. Federal Communications Commission Chairman Tom Wheeler warned Republicans against dismantling the Obama administration's landmark "net neutrality" protections that bar internet service providers from slowing consumer access to web content.
title: Outgoing FCC chair warns against overturning net neutrality

description: DAVOS, Switzerland (Reuters) - Open markets and global trade have been blamed for job losses over the last decade, but global CEOs say the real culprits are increasingly machines.
title: Impact of job-stealing robots a growing concern at Davos

description: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] has hired the man behind Google search to work closely with Chief Executive Travis Kalanick and help grow the company's self-driving car program.
title: Uber hires Google search veteran Singhal for senior engineering post

description: (Reuters) - Aviation electronics maker Rockwell Collins Inc's defense business is "really busy right now," reflecting a new emphasis on defense spending, Chief Executive Officer Kelly Ortberg said on Friday.
title: Rockwell Collins sees defense market uptick, small 777 impact

description: SEOUL (Reuters) - South Korea's special prosecutor's office said on Friday it  summoned a Samsung Electronics Co Ltd executive for questioning as it investigates a widening influence-peddling scandal that has embroiled President Park Geun-hye.
title: South Korea prosecutors summon another Samsung executive

description: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Traditional TV networks are following Netflix Inc's  lead by releasing all new episodes of a series at the same time, a step to win over binge viewers who do not want to wait a week for the next installment.
title: More TV networks follow Netflix to binge-watching model

description: TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan's Toshiba Corp  has begun preparations to sell a minority stake in its core chip business, people with knowledge of the matter said, as it urgently seeks funding to avoid being crippled by an upcoming multibillion-dollar writedown.
title: Toshiba making preparations for sale of stake in chip business -sources

description: (Reuters) - A small moth with a yellowish-white coif of scales has been named after U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, in honor of the former reality TV show host and real estate magnate's signature hairdo.
title: Small moth with yellowish coif named after Donald Trump

description: (Reuters) - Six scientists have entered a dome perched atop a remote volcano in Hawaii where they will spend the next eight months in isolation to simulate life for astronauts traveling to Mars, the University of Hawaii said.
title: Scientists enter Hawaii dome in eight-month Mars space mission study

DATES.DATE3: the third year in a row in 2016

description: OSLO (Reuters) - World temperatures hit a record high for the third year in a row in 2016, creeping closer to a ceiling set for global warming with extremes including unprecedented heat in India and ice melt in the Arctic, U.S. government agencies said on Wednesday.
title: World temperatures hit new high in 2016 for third year in a row

description: EINDHOVEN, Netherlands (Reuters) - While plenty of cannabis goes up in smoke in coffee shops around the Netherlands, Dutch researchers have found a new use for it - as an environmentally friendly building material to rival cement or steel.
title: Hemp hits new high as building material on Dutch bridge

description: (Reuters) - Europe's leading association of oncologists has thrown its weight behind cheaper copycat versions of biotech cancer drugs that have lost patent protection, saying they are effective and affordable.
title: Europe's oncologists back biosimilar versions of cancer drugs

description: LONDON (Reuters) - The British Antarctic Society is recalling scientists from its Halley VI polar research base in March after a fissure developed in the ice sheet.
title: Antarctic ice floe crack forces UK scientists to leave

description: LUSAKA (Reuters) - A maize pest that has devastated crops in southern Africa is a South American species which is harder to detect and eradicate than its African counterpart, agriculture officials and experts said on Tuesday.
title: Southern African maize munching pest is South American invader: experts
